name: Mereth
appearance: River-blue vestments edged with tide-bells; a calm, stone-quiet face and hands that smell faintly of river salt.
character: Patient, persuasive, and publicly compassionate; he guides crowds like a careful ferry in fog.
talents: Reads oaths’ weak points from speech
Finds omens in water-bows and spill patterns
flaws: Blind to internal schism until late
dreams: Preserve the covenant of the Nine Tides
Reopen public ritual access at contested sites
Humble the Weir’s arrogance without breaking it
secrets: Owns a drowned bell that can end any storm once for an unnamed life
Keeps jars of the river’s anger; three show hairline cracks
Privately believes dredging the Charterstone might be permissible with true omen
